description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mebt","text":"This protocol describes how to stain paraffin wax embedded sections of tissue for alpha-synuclein by immunofluorescence or DAB/peroxidase immunohistochemistry and is based on Hurley et al., 2013 (https://doi.org/10.1093/brain/awt134). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":196,"length":36}],"data":{}},{"key":"7339e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqe38","text":"The protocol works for many other antibodies and the only change necessary for most antibodies is determining the optimal dilution of the primary antibody and the best type of antigen-retrieval to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"18124E1BB69311ED9EF70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/brain/awt134"}}}}
